data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you ever face forward, you always face forward. If you always face left or right, you always face away from the center of the screen. This means, that you always face right. Thus, the answer is true.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you turn right from the starting point, you are reverting to the starting point from the moment you went in the first step. If you turn around, you are reverting to the starting point from the moment you stepped in the first step. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The number of steps in the direction you came from start at 6 and go back to 7 at the corresponding directions. The number of steps in the direction you came from start at 4, go back to 4 at the corresponding directions. The number of steps in the direction you came from start at 10, all back at 6! Taking 6 steps is a repetition of taking 4 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Taking a step gives you 7 steps. If you take step 7, the same number of steps you took the first time goes back to 7. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and take 5 steps, reversing what you are doing. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn around, you would turn right. To turn left, you would turn left. If you return to from around, you would turn around again and turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn right. There is a right direction in the picture ook. So, the answer is yes.

Take 2 steps back. To return to the starting point, you would take 6. Turn around, took 8. Take 2 steps back. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward in the beginning, you will always go forward in the end. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 1 step forward and 1 step back. Take 9 steps and turn around and make a 180. Take 2 steps forward and 1 step back. Take 3 steps forward and 1 step back. Take 3 steps forward and 1 step back. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always see your direction it is not possible to take 1 step backward in the same direction you always saw you going from. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One has to face forward to go backward. You’ re not required to take any steps backward. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Walking backward means that we are not facing forward. In this step-by-step procedure we are always facing forward. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Any time you go down a ramp, you are always facing upwards. So, if you always get up in straight and not descended steps, you cannot go back to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If someone is facing toward someone else and has been standing i would say take 3 steps right. If they are facing in the direction you are now, take 3 steps right again. If you are still facing in the direction you are now, take 6 steps left. If you are still facing in the direction you are now, take 6 steps right. If, you are now facing in the direction you were before, take 3 steps right again. If they are facing inside you would say just go through that one step backwards and then make the turn at the next step. If you are now facing at side with 2 left turns and 1 right turn, step to the right and take 3 steps right. Thus, the answer is yes.

You take 4 steps going around. 4 steps going around will take you back to the starting point. All instructions require you to take 10 steps. If you take 8 steps, you take 8 steps. You can only turn around once. So, the answer is Yes.

If you start from a point, you cannot go back to the same point. It takes 10 steps to go back when you take a certain number of steps. In this case, you would only take 9 steps to go back once. So, the answer is No.

Depending on what order you take the steps, you can either take 9 steps or 7 steps. You can only turn around if you have been turned right. So, the answer is no.

You start with 7 steps and take 6 steps. You take 2 steps right and 5 steps back. The first steps are 8 steps left. The next steps are 2 steps right and 3 steps backward. The first steps are 9 steps forward and 9 steps backward. So, the answer is Yes.
